scenario: The U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) issued a public health alert for frozen Chicken Curry Empanadas due to misbranding and an undeclared allergen. The product, produced by Rajbhog Foods, may contain Apple Cinnamon Empanadas with milk, a known allergen, not declared on the label. The affected product was shipped to Walmart locations nationwide and was produced on November 14, 2024, and packaged on November 20 and 21, 2024. The product is a 9.6-oz. cardboard package labeled as "bettergoods TRADITIONALLY CRAFTED Chicken Curry Empanadas" with "BEST BY: 05/21/26" or "BEST BY: 05/22/26" and "EST. P33967" on the side of the box. There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions, but consumers are urged not to consume the product and to return it to the place of purchase or throw it away. The FSIS is concerned that some product may still be in consumers' freezers.
